name: DBScan
description: Performs DBScan clustering on the first input data provided. The output consists of the original input with a Cluster field appended. If a second input is available, it will be used as output instead.
introductoryText: Density-based spatial clustering of applications with noise (DBSCAN) is a data clustering algorithm proposed by Martin Ester, Hans-Peter Kriegel, JÃ¶rg Sander and Xiaowei Xu in 1996. It is a density-based clustering non-parametric algorithm: given a set of points in some space, it groups together points that are closely packed together (points with many nearby neighbors), marking as outliers points that lie alone in low-density regions (whose nearest neighbors are too far away). DBSCAN is one of the most common clustering algorithms and also most cited in scientific literature.

options.name: useAllNumericFields
options.title: Use all numeric fields
options.description: If checked, all numeric fields in the data will be used. If not checked, you have to specify the fields in the option "Fields to use"
